newsitem.title: UK: UK's FTSE 100 opens firm, gets boost from U.S..
newsitem.headline: UK's FTSE 100 opens firm, gets boost from U.S..

text.p: The UK's FTSE 100 index of leading shares opened firmer on Wednesday after hitting a new intraday peak in pre-market trade following the Dow's second biggest single day point gain in history.
The index had climbed 28 points to 4,461.2 by 0741 GMT, just below the all-time record of 4,466.3, set on March 11. Only ten stocks were registering losses and three were unchanged.
"It's not the kind of thing you expect on the eve of a general election," said one equity salesman.
U.S. stocks had soared on Tuesday following economic data, which prompted a rethink of interest rate concerns.
